page.title: 08FARMING
page.content: The main feature of our area is {farming. There are approximately{7 farm {steadings,}all previously owned by the Middleton family. However today 4 are owner-occupied. These farms lie to the south west of the Castle and Hall. The emphasis is on{stock rearing and {sheep farming}with arable crops becoming more important in recent years. The local farmers sell their stock at{Scots Gap and Ponteland Marts,}but often go a little further away to{ {Hexham.}Breeding stock is bought from larger markets in the{Borders and {Scotland,}or in the{south of England and in later years from{France and {Belgium.}Limousin and Charolais cross beast are more prominent than the more traditional Hereford.
